meanings.sent1: The soft, warm blanket was a tangible comfort on the chilly night.
meanings.sent2: The wooden table and chairs were solid tangibles in the room.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy mistook the slipper for a tangible chew toy.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a tangible presence in the community, felt by all.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the painting made the artwork a tangible delight.

meanings.definition: Capable of being touched or felt; tangible evidence
meanings.sent1: The detective carefully collected all the tangible clues at the crime scene.
meanings.sent2: The rough texture of the rock made it a tangible object to study.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy mistook the slipper for tangible evidence of a hidden treat.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a tangible force that guided her through challenges.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread was a tangible reminder of home.

meanings.definition: Real or actual, rather than imaginary or visionary; tangible results
meanings.sent1: The tangible benefits of exercise include improved health and energy.
meanings.sent2: The tangible success of the project was evident in the positive feedback.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy mistook the slipper for tangible results of a playful game.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her craft yielded tangible rewards in the form of recognition.
meanings.sent5: The sound of applause was a tangible validation of her talent.
